@TraverHart @krisnova Russia could try to block/redirect all, say, UDP port 53 traffic at the network border, but that wouldn‚Äôt help if Google had anycast 8.8.8.8 servers running inside Russia.

They could redirect _all_ residential ISP port 53 traffic, regardless of destination. Is that the case?

subs.text:
@EugeneGTI @LandgrafpfPaul @gwoodsii @Charles67861159 @TrentTelenko @MarkrKeogh You don‚Äôt have to take out the bridge from the air or the sea. You just need a saboteur in Crimea and ISR.

A remotely-detonated bomb on one of the returning locomotives while crossing the bridge might cause at least a temporary blockage.
subs.rawText:
@EugeneGTI @LandgrafpfPaul @gwoodsii @Charles67861159 @TrentTelenko @MarkrKeogh You don‚Äôt have to take out the bridge from the air or the sea. You just need a saboteur in Crimea and ISR.

subs.text:
@EugeneGTI @LandgrafpfPaul @gwoodsii @Charles67861159 @TrentTelenko @MarkrKeogh Actually, assuming the bridge is some point taller than the rest of Crimea, an altimeter trigger might work in lieu of a remote.

Set one altitude range to arm, and another altitude range to detonate?

Cheap solid-state sensors challenge 20th century doctrine.

#4dBattlefield

subs.text:
@TheSpicedLife @melania_jacket @igorsushko A FSB analyst has had a long-running correspondence with a well-known Russian anti-prison-torture activist who is currently living in France.

At least seven of those letters have been forwarded to @igorsushko since the beginning of the war, and he has kindly translated them.

subs.text:
@GrkStav @RaulACarrillo You‚Äôre right, in terms of #MonetaryRate policy, options are:

1. raise interest rates
2. maintain interest rates
3. lower interest rates

4. announce / telegraph / threaten to do one of the above three things for some period of time

5. make a habit of doing #4, then say nothing

5. make a habit of doing #4, then say nothing

subs.text:
@stevecalamia @horsemankukka @JosephPolitano People tend to have fairly narrow viewing horizons, too.

Look at debates a region has (e.g. health care policy debates) and compare how much time they spend arguing over hypotheticals and projections vs. how little detailed discourse there is about working models elsewhere.

#Putin won‚Äôt capitulate.

Clips such as the one above suggest they are now priming the population to support a wider war.

@dangerwookie @igorsushko Yes to the fear part, but contrasting that, this letter says that they‚Äôre not expecting the ‚Äòwest‚Äô to react with force, but to capitulate.

Also, an earlier letter mentioned a crack-down at the #FSB and that the author was exhausted and burnt out. Lots of variables.
subs.rawText:
@dangerwookie @igorsushko Yes to the fear part, but contrasting that, this letter says that they‚Äôre not expecting the ‚Äòwest‚Äô to react with force, but to capitulate.

subs.text: @dangerwookie @igorsushko Yeah, he didn‚Äôt explain until the following letter, but I imagine the recipient (with whom he has had a long-running correspondence) could see from context that these were not the analyst‚Äôs own thoughts but rather the analyst retelling of a plan being formulated inside the FSB.
subs.rawText: @dangerwookie @igorsushko Yeah, he didn‚Äôt explain until the following letter, but I imagine the recipient (with whom he has had a long-running correspondence) could see from context that these were not the analyst‚Äôs own thoughts but rather the analyst retelling of a plan being formulated inside the FSB.

@Glaukopos @IronMonkeeMN @Aviation_Intel @TrentTelenko @NATO If Putin wanted war with @NATO, he would attack @NATO.

@joanna_c_chiu @Xu_Reno @SRBR_Outreach Individuals and communities _don‚Äôt need to wait_ on any official actions to start shifting away from #timezones in general.

subs.text:
@joanna_c_chiu @Xu_Reno @SRBR_Outreach Those living at the extreme eastern and western edges of a time zone have significantly different experiences with #time.

Local time: Sailors used it for centuries. Animals still do.

AFAIK, computers generally only use time zones (i.e. #UTCoffset) when _displaying_ time.

2/6

A - Russian Special Forces(SSO) (e.g. Spetznaz)
subs.rawText:
@cormacleane @mairtinofaolain @evangershkovich Unverified:

V - Marines
Z - Eastern Military District
Z in a square - Southern Military District (Crimea)
O - units from Belarus
X - forces of Ramzan Kadyrov, Putin installed warlord of Chechnya 
A - Russian Special Forces(SSO) (e.g. Spetznaz)
